ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Gold Platted Crappy Weapon
ygData.msgSnippet: Umm I hate to break this to you, Thex, but I use two proc ing weapons and they _routinely_ fire off 3-4 times a fight and sometimes several more.  I had one
ygData.messageBody:
Umm I hate to break this to you, Thex, but I use two proc'ing weapons and
they _routinely_ fire off 3-4 times a fight and sometimes several more. I
had one fight where my ugly stick proc'd 7 times in a row (esp primary hand)
Then again my un-buffed dex is 150.

Who needs AC anyway? I'm not a tank!

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath
----- Original Message -----
From: "Eric Boller" <eboller@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, March 10, 2000 10:37 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Gold Platted Crappy Weapon


> From: Eric Boller <eboller@...>
>
> Who cares about the proc? Most weapons don't average
> more than 1 proc every 45 seconds or so anyway
> (contrary to most people's belief that they average 4
> or 5 procs per fight). The damage/delay is better
> than the ykesha and ebw (not taking into account magic
> numbers and lower delay,etc). I guess I still don't
> see why you guys think it is crappy. Granted it is
> off a dragon and is only marginally better than your
> ykesh or ebw. However, unless you have a planar
> weapon I would consider this better. Anyway, anyone
> on Tunare who think this weapon is crappy--I will
> gladly take your crappy weapon!
>
> Thex Luteslinger (Tunare)
> 37th level bard
>
> > Message: 5
> > Date: Thu, 9 Mar 2000 14:46:12 -0500
> > From: Greg Gillan <ggillan@...>
> > Subject: RE: Re: Gold Plated Koshigitana
> >
> > Just looks like a dagger.
> > It would be a great weapon if not for 2 things.
> > 1. There are next to no summoned creatures in the
> > game, at least at the
> > level you're likely to obtain this weapon.
> > 2. The proc rate on it is perhaps the worst I have
> > ever seen. It hardly
> > ever goes off.
>
